content: Various Rules for Priests
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“Tell Aaron and his sons to be careful with the holy  of the sons of Israel, which they dedicate to Me, so as not to profane My holy name; I am the .

Say to them, ‘Any man among all your descendants throughout your generations who approaches the holy  which the sons of Israel consecrate to the , while he has an uncleanness, that person shall be cut off from My presence; I am the .

No man of the descendants of Aaron, who has leprosy or has a discharge, may eat of the holy  until he is clean. And one who touches anything made unclean by a corpse, or a man who has a seminal emission,
or a man who touches any swarming things by which he is made unclean, or  any person by whom he is made unclean, whatever his uncleanness;
a person who touches any such thing shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy  unless he has bathed his body in water.
But when the sun sets, he will be clean, and afterward he may eat of the holy , for it is his food.
He shall not eat  which dies or is torn , becoming unclean by it; I am the .
They shall therefore perform  duty to Me, so that they do not bear sin because of it and die by it because they profane it; I am the  who sanctifies them.
‘No layman, however, is to eat the holy ; a foreign resident with the priest or a hired worker shall not eat the holy .
But if a priest buys a slave as  property with his money, that person may eat of it, and those who are born in his house may eat of his food.
If a priest’s daughter is married to a layman, she shall not eat of the offering of the holy .
But if a priest’s daughter becomes a widow or divorced, and has no child and returns to her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food; but no layman shall eat of it.
If, however, someone eats a holy  unintentionally, then he shall add to it a fifth of it and shall give the holy  to the priest.
And they shall not profane the holy  of the sons of Israel, which they offer to the ,
and  bring upon them punishment for guilt by eating their holy ; for I am the  who sanctifies them.’”
Flawless Animals for Sacrifice
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to Aaron and to his sons, and to all the sons of Israel, and say to them, ‘Anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel who presents his offering, whether it is any of their vows or any of their voluntary offerings, which they present to the  as a burnt offering—
for you to be accepted— a male without defect from the cattle, the sheep, or the goats.
Whatever has a defect, you shall not offer, for it will not be accepted for you.

When someone offers a sacrifice of peace offerings to the  to fulfill a special vow or for a voluntary offering, of the herd or of the flock, it must be without defect to be accepted; there shall be no defect in it.
blind, fractured, maimed, or  a wart, a festering rash, or scabs, you shall not offer to the , nor make of them an offering by fire on the altar to the .
Now  an ox or a lamb which has an overgrown or stunted , you may present it as a voluntary offering, but for a vow it will not be accepted.
Also anything  squashed, crushed, torn off, or cut off, you shall not offer to the , nor sacrifice in your land,
nor shall you offer any of these  from the hand of a foreigner as the food of your God; for their deformity is in them, they have an impairment. They will not be accepted for you.’”
Then the  spoke to Moses, saying,
“When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall remain seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day on it will be considered acceptable as a sacrifice of an offering by fire to the .
But,  it is an ox or a sheep, you shall not slaughter  it and its young in one day.
When you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the , you shall sacrifice it so that you may be accepted.
It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall leave none of it until morning. I am the .
So you shall keep My commandments, and do them; I am the .
“And you shall not profane My holy name, but I will be sanctified among the sons of Israel; I am the  who sanctifies you,
who brought you out from the land of Egypt, to be your God; I am the .”
